intro: Cymation laevigatum, commonly known as the smooth cyme plant, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its smooth, waxy leaves and clusters of small, fragrant white flowers. The plant belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in tropical forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for study in plant morphology and ecology.
